questions.question_text_1: If a model predicts the positive class for all observations in a binary classification problem with both positive and negative cases present, which of the following statements is true?
question_texts: If a model predicts the positive class for all observations in a binary classification problem with both positive and negative cases present, which of the following statements is true?

options.option_text: Precision is 100%, but Recall is not necessarily 100%.
Recall is 100%, but Precision is not necessarily 100%.

questions.question_text_1: The Bankruptcy Bank, one of the major lending banks, has hired you to build a credit underwriting model to help their automated lending decisions. Their definition of default is 60-89 DPD. There is historical loans data since January 1, 2021 till 31, July 2024. Which of the following is true – as of July 31, 2024?
question_texts: The Bankruptcy Bank, one of the major lending banks, has hired you to build a credit underwriting model to help their automated lending decisions. Their definition of default is 60-89 DPD. There is historical loans data since January 1, 2021 till 31, July 2024. Which of the following is true – as of July 31, 2024?

options.option_text: Jan’21– Jul’24 is used for performance data
Apl’24 – Jul’24 is used for observation data
Jan’21 – Apl’24 is used for observation data
May’24 – Jul’24 is used for performance data
Jan’21 – Jan’24 is used for observation data

questions.question_text_1: Given the sentence:  "Customer sign-up rates have increased by 25% in the last quarter."  Output:  ['customer', 'sign', 'up', 'rates', 'increased', '25', 'last', 'quarter']  Which of the following text preprocessing techniques was NOT applied to the sentence?
question_texts: Given the sentence:  "Customer sign-up rates have increased by 25% in the last quarter."  Output:  ['customer', 'sign', 'up', 'rates', 'increased', '25', 'last', 'quarter']  Which of the following text preprocessing techniques was NOT applied to the sentence?

questions.question_text_1: What is reject inferencing in the context of machine learning?
question_texts: What is reject inferencing in the context of machine learning?

options.option_text: A technique to infer missing data points
A method to handle rejected cases in a dataset
A process to reject outliers in the dataset
A way to accept all data points without filtering

questions.question_text_1: In the context of reject inferencing, what does 'good reject' refer to?
question_texts: In the context of reject inferencing, what does 'good reject' refer to?

options.option_text: A rejected case that should have been accepted based on model prediction
A rejected case used as a reference for model adjustments

questions.question_text_1: In a credit risk scenario, if a model has high recall but low precision, it implies that:
question_texts: In a credit risk scenario, if a model has high recall but low precision, it implies that:

options.option_text: The model correctly identifies a high percentage of non-risky customers butmakes many mistakes in identifying risky customers.
The model correctly identifies a high percentage of risky customers but alsoincorrectly labels many non-risky customers as risky.
The model correctly identifies a high percentage of non-risky customers andmakes few mistakes in identifying risky customers
The model correctly identifies a high percentage of risky customers and makesfew mistakes in identifying non-risky customers.

questions.question_text_1: Which scenario is likely to occur if a credit risk model is optimized solely for high recall?
question_texts: Which scenario is likely to occur if a credit risk model is optimized solely for high recall?

options.option_text: Most non-risky customers will be correctly identified.
Most risky customers will be correctly identified.
Many non-risky customers will be incorrectly labeled as risky.
Many risky customers will be incorrectly labeled as non-risky.

questions.question_text_1: In a SHAP summary plot, what does the colour of the points typically represent?
question_texts: In a SHAP summary plot, what does the colour of the points typically represent?

options.option_text: The magnitude of the SHAP values
The value of the feature (e.g., high or low)

questions.question_text_1: What does “local predictability” refer to in the context of SHAP explanations?
question_texts: What does “local predictability” refer to in the context of SHAP explanations?

options.option_text: The ability of SHAP values to explain the contribution of features to individualpredictions
The general accuracy of the model across the entire dataset
The average SHAP value for a feature across multiple predictions
The consistency of SHAP values across different models

questions.question_text_1: Info Systems Inc. has sales of ₹ 2,820, costs of goods sold of ₹ 2,160, inventory of ₹504, and accounts receivable of ₹ 430. How many days, on average, does it take Info Systems Inc. to sell its inventory?

questions.question_text_1: You have been awarded an insurance settlement of ₹ 250,000 that is payable one year from today. What is the minimum amount you should accept today in exchange for this settlement if you can earn 6.7 percent on your investments?
question_texts: You have been awarded an insurance settlement of ₹ 250,000 that is payable one year from today. What is the minimum amount you should accept today in exchange for this settlement if you can earn 6.7 percent on your investments?

questions.question_text_1: An insurance settlement offer includes annual payments of ₹ 36,000, ₹ 42,000, and ₹ 50,000 over the next three years, respectively, with the first payment being made one year from today. What is the minimum amount you should accept today as a lumpsum settlement if your discount rate is 7 percent?
question_texts: An insurance settlement offer includes annual payments of ₹ 36,000, ₹ 42,000, and ₹ 50,000 over the next three years, respectively, with the first payment being made one year from today. What is the minimum amount you should accept today as a lumpsum settlement if your discount rate is 7 percent?

questions.question_text_1: Scott has been offered an employment contract for ten years at a starting salary of ₹ 65,000 with guaranteed annual raises of 5 percent. What is the current value of this offer at a discount rate of 7 percent?
question_texts: Scott has been offered an employment contract for ten years at a starting salary of ₹ 65,000 with guaranteed annual raises of 5 percent. What is the current value of this offer at a discount rate of 7 percent?

questions.question_text_1: Which statement concerning the net present value (NPV) of an investment or a financing project is correct?
question_texts: Which statement concerning the net present value (NPV) of an investment or a financing project is correct?

options.option_text: A financing project should be accepted if, and only if, the NPV is exactly equalto zero.
An investment project should be accepted only if the NPV is equal to the initialcash flow.
Any type of project should be accepted if the NPV is positive and rejected if it isnegative.
Any type of project with greater total cash inflows than total cash outflows,should always be accepted.

questions.question_text_1: Wilson's Market is considering two mutually exclusive projects that will not be repeated. The required rate of return is 13.9 percent for Project A and 12.5 percent for Project B. Project A has an initial cost of ₹54,500, and should produce cash inflows of ₹16,400, ₹28,900, and ₹31,700 for Years 1 to 3, respectively. Project B has an initial cost of ₹69,400, and should produce cash inflows of ₹0, ₹48,300, and ₹42,100, for Years 1 to 3, respectively. Which project, or projects, if either, should be accepted and why?
question_texts: Wilson's Market is considering two mutually exclusive projects that will not be repeated. The required rate of return is 13.9 percent for Project A and 12.5 percent for Project B. Project A has an initial cost of ₹54,500, and should produce cash inflows of ₹16,400, ₹28,900, and ₹31,700 for Years 1 to 3, respectively. Project B has an initial cost of ₹69,400, and should produce cash inflows of ₹0, ₹48,300, and ₹42,100, for Years 1 to 3, respectively. Which project, or projects, if either, should be accepted and why?

options.option_text: Project A; because its NPV is positive while Project B's NPV is negative
Project A; because it has the higher required rate of return
Project B; because it has the largest total cash inflow
Neither project; because neither has an NPV equal to or greater than its initialcost

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following statements are true with respect to ACF and PACF plots  I. ACF plots are used to determining the order of Autoregressive models. II. PACF plots are used to determining the order of Autoregressive models. III. PACF plots just computes the Pearson’s correlation between the variable and it’s lagged versions. IV. ACF plots just computes the Pearson’s correlation between the variable and it’s lagged versions.
question_texts: Which of the following statements are true with respect to ACF and PACF plots  I. ACF plots are used to determining the order of Autoregressive models. II. PACF plots are used to determining the order of Autoregressive models. III. PACF plots just computes the Pearson’s correlation between the variable and it’s lagged versions. IV. ACF plots just computes the Pearson’s correlation between the variable and it’s lagged versions.

questions.question_text_1: What does the term 'liquidity' refer to in the context of a Balance Sheet?
question_texts: What does the term 'liquidity' refer to in the context of a Balance Sheet?

options.option_text: The amount of cash a company has on hand.
The company's ability to pay off its short-term obligations.
The total value of a company’s assets.
The value of the company's long-term investments.

questions.question_text_1: XYZ Consulting paid dividends of ₹ 3,300 and total equity of ₹ 39,450. The debt-equity ratio is 1 and the retention ratio (the ratio of a company's retained income to its net income) is 40 percent. What is the return on assets expressed in percentage?
question_texts: XYZ Consulting paid dividends of ₹ 3,300 and total equity of ₹ 39,450. The debt-equity ratio is 1 and the retention ratio (the ratio of a company's retained income to its net income) is 40 percent. What is the return on assets expressed in percentage?

questions.question_text_1: Anu’s foods has net income of ₹ 39,900, net sales of ₹ 3,18,600, total assets of ₹ 6,63,000, common stock of ₹ 1,06,800 with a par value of ₹1 per share, and retained earnings of ₹2,24,400. The stock has a market value of ₹ 5.45 per share. What is the price-earnings ratio expressed in percentage?
question_texts: Anu’s foods has net income of ₹ 39,900, net sales of ₹ 3,18,600, total assets of ₹ 6,63,000, common stock of ₹ 1,06,800 with a par value of ₹1 per share, and retained earnings of ₹2,24,400. The stock has a market value of ₹ 5.45 per share. What is the price-earnings ratio expressed in percentage?

question_texts: A firm has a return on equity of 25 percent. The total asset turnover is 2.4 and the profit margin is 8 percent. The total equity is ₹ 4,100. What is the net income?
